Docs.summary: Indicates how to play sounds when calling audio methods.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use the `AudioPlayMode` enumeration members to control how the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Audio.Play%2A> method plays sounds.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.AudioPlayMode Background = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Causes the `My.Computer.Audio.Play` method to play the sound in the background. The calling code continues to execute.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.AudioPlayMode BackgroundLoop = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Causes the `My.Computer.Audio.Play` method to play the sound in the background until the M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Audio.Stop?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True method is called. The calling code continues to execute.
